com.viaoa.jfc.editor.html.control

Class Class2ImageHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.viaoa.jfc.editor.html.control.Class2ImageHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ImageHandlerInterface

    public class Class2ImageHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements ImageHandlerInterface
    Used by OAHTMLTextPane to use OAObjects to store images in an OAObject. This will use an Image src protocol/scheme of "oaproperty://className.../prop?id" and will also work when setting the HTML src attribute to the value of the object Id or by finding the src in the objects sourceName. Note: this is not needed for readonly/reports, only for Editors; since the "oaproperty://" url Handler will be able to find the image in the object property.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Class2ImageHandler

        public Class2ImageHandler(OAHTMLTextPane txtHtml,
                  java.lang.Class<? extends OAObject> clazz,
                  java.lang.String byteArrayPropertyName,
                  java.lang.String sourceNamePropertyName,
                  java.lang.String idPropertyName)
        Parameters:
        hubCompany - Hub that has all images in it.
        byteArrayPropertyName - name of property that is for a byte[] to store "raw"
        sourceNamePropertyName - property to use to store the source of the image (ex: file name)
        idPropertyName - unique property value to use for the html img src tag. If null, then sourceNamePropertyName will be used.

    • Method Detail

      • getObject

        protected OAObject getObject(java.lang.String srcName)
        Finds the object that is storing the image, using the html image src attribute. This will take 3 approaches to find the object: 1: if using oaproperty:// scheme, it will use the value after "?" as the object id. 2: it will use the src as the object Id. 3: if will find object based on the sourceName property in the object.
        Parameters:
        srcName - URL of image.
        Returns:
        object that is storing the image
        See Also:
        used by HTMLTextPane to directly get image from OAObject property
